question: India’s first air pollution web repository “IndAIR” has been launched by which organisation?
explanation: India’s first air pollution web repository -  IndAIR – have been launched by National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) along with the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) that documents air quality studies done in the last 60 years. The aim of the project is to make air quality research available to everyone. The Indian Air quality Interactive Repository (IndAIR) has archived approximately 700 scanned materials from pre-Internet era (1950-1999), 1,215 research articles, 170 reports and case studies and 100 cases, to provide the history of air pollution research and legislation. Such a repository on air pollution is one of the first in the world.
